attributes.value: The new chancellor Jeremy Hunt has admitted there were “mistakes” in the mini-budget as he warned that taxes might have to go up along with spending cuts to balance the books.
In his first outing on the airwaves in his new role this morning, Hunt told Sky News: “We won’t have the speed of tax cuts we were hoping for and some taxes will go up.”

Although the chancellor said he could not commit to cutting a penny of income tax as pledged in Kwasi Kwarteng’s mini budget, he said it was his hope to retain the promised tax cut once he had completed a review of the measures.
But he warned there would still be “difficult” decisions to take on public spending as he
